data.title: University of Colorado Athletics
data.meta_description: Devee Harris (33) Outside Linebacker - AT COLORADO Played in twelve games starting zero Recorded 14 total tackles including five unassisted and one for loss ...
data.text:
AT COLORADO

Played in twelve games starting zero

Recorded 14 total tackles including five unassisted and one for loss

Recorded 3 tackles on fifteen snaps against UCLA and was graded 70.8 by PFF

TRANSFER RANKING

Rated as a three-star prospect in the transfer portal by 247, which rated him at .8700. He was ranked as the No. 558 overall player in the portal and the No. 28 Edge Defender.

He came to Colorado with two years to play two.

AT OLD DOMINION

Has appeared in 23 games across two seasons with three starts totaling 57 tackles, eight and a half for loss, five sacks, one fumble recovery, and two interceptions.

In 2022 he appeared in 10 games at defensive end and recorded 32 tackles, two and a half sacks, four tackles for loss, and one interception.

Scored his third career touchdown and second career pick-six in the win over Arkansas State

In 2021 he played in 13 games at defensive end, making three starts and registered 24 tackles, two and a half sacks, four and a half tackles for loss, and a fumble recovery and an interception that both resulted in touchdowns.

He became the first defensive player in Old Dominion history to score two defensive touchdowns in the same season.

AT MINNESOTA

In 2020 he appeared in one game against Purdue and registered one tackle.

Did not see any action during the 2019 season.

HIGH SCHOOL RANKINGS

A three-star prospect by the recruiting services.

ESPN ranked him as the No. 6 Edge, and the No. 10 player from Missouri.

On3 listed him as the No. 790 player in the nation, the No. 76 Edge, and the No. 16 player from Missouri.

247 Sports ranked him the No. 71 Edge and the No. 24 player from Missouri.

247 Composite listed him as the No. 817 player in the nation, the No. 53 Edge, and the No. 17 player from Missouri.

Rivals ranked him as the No. 46 Edge, and the No. 17 player from Missouri.

AT LUTHERAN NORTH HIGH SCHOOL

He played varsity football for head coach Carl Reed at Lutheran North High School in Saint Louis, Mo.

He ended his high school career with 263 tackles, 67 tackles for a loss, 20 sacks, and three fumble recoveries.

Received Missouri All-State honors, All-Metro Defensive Player of the Year and First-team Metro League All-Conference

As a senior, totaled 125 tackles, 29 tackles for loss, eight sacks and recovered two fumbles

As a junior, made 74 tackles, 14 tackles for loss and six sacks

As a sophomore, registered 64 tackles, 24 tackles for loss, six sacks and recovered one fumble.
